snippet: The two countries ended their first direct talks in four years on Friday with an agreement to meet as early as next month, in a sign of the North’s desire to reduce tensions with Japan, and by extension, the United States.
abstract: Japan and North Korea end their first direct talks in four years by agreeing to meet in the near future, in a sign of the North's desire to reduce tensions with Japan, and by extension, the United States.
lead_paragraph: The two countries ended their first direct talks in four years on Friday with an agreement to meet as early as next month, in a sign of the North’s desire to reduce tensions with Japan, and by extension, the United States.

headline.seo: Japan and North Korea Agree to New Talks
headline.main: Japan and North Korea Agree to New Talks
headline.print_headline: Japan and North Korea Agree to Hold More Talks
